comments:
I think WSIComplianceUtils is used to be in org.eclipse.wst.ws.ui but got moved to org.eclipse.wst.ws.  However, the MessageUtils it tries to create is still org.eclipse.wst.ws.ui, thus resulting in the following exception:

IWAB0014E Unexpected exception occured.
  Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.wst.ws.ui.plugin, locale en_CA
      java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.wst.ws.ui.plugin, locale en_CA
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException(ResourceBundle.java:825)
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl(ResourceBundle.java:715)
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:682)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.common.MessageUtils.<init>(MessageUtils.java:53)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.common.MessageUtils.<init>(MessageUtils.java:38)
      at org.eclipse.wst.ws.internal.preferences.WSIComplianceUtils.checkWSICompliance(WSIComplianceUtils.java:54)
Kathy, if you please...

Created an attachment (id=31386)
Patch for wst.ws
Patch for wst.ws to change the pluginid used in WSIComplianceUtils.  This patch is ready to be committed.
Reviewed, committed and released under tag v20051208_1210.

I tested and it still does not work, the reason is because there is no plugin.properties in this plugin anymore.  And this is the stacktrace:

  Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.wst.ws.plugin, locale en_US
      java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name org.eclipse.wst.ws.plugin, locale en_US
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.throwMissingResourceException(ResourceBundle.java:825)
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundleImpl(ResourceBundle.java:794)
      at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:682)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.common.MessageUtils.<init>(MessageUtils.java:53)
      at org.eclipse.wst.command.internal.env.core.common.MessageUtils.<init>(MessageUtils.java:38)
      at org.eclipse.wst.ws.internal.preferences.WSIComplianceUtils.checkWSICompliance(WSIComplianceUtils.java:54)

This problem exist because part of WSIComplianceUtils was not ported over to use the new NLS message bundle.  Since the WTP code does not use WSIComplianceUtils in any of the flow for Axis Web service, this problem was not detected.

I would provide a patch for fixing this problem for WTP 1.0 and would commit the change for WTP 1.0.1.

Kelvin has tested the updated JARs and verified that the fix works for him.  

I've attached the code patch and updated JARs for this fix.  It will be committed once WTP 1.0 is released.

BTW, you could also copy the WSIComplianceUtils file and provide your own implementation.  The class is currently in an internal package.
